processing module

Provides advanced functions for processing MRI brain images.

processing.adjust_brain(src1: ndarray, src2: ndarray, src3: ndarray) → ndarray

Adjust the brain image by adding the parts of the brain that may have been lost in previous processes

Parameters:

  • src1 (np.ndarray.) – Original image.

  • src2 (np.ndarray.) – Brain image.

  • src3 (np.ndarray.) – Skull image.

Returns:

Adjusted image of the brain.

Return type:

np.ndarray

processing.adjust_image(src: ndarray) → ndarray

Processes an MRI image by performing the following operations:

  • Denoising the image using split-Bregman optimization.

  • Histogram equalization.

  • Setting the background color to black.

Parameters:

src (np.ndarray) – Image to be adjusted.

Returns:

Adjusted image.

Return type:

np.ndarray

processing.find_best_brain_contour(src: ndarray) → tuple

Find the best contour of the brain.

Parameters:

src (np.ndarray.) – Brain image to be processed.

Returns:

Processed image and mask of the contour.

Return type:

tuple

processing.merge_images(src1: ndarray, src2: ndarray) → ndarray

Merges two images.

Parameters:

  • src1 (np.ndarray.) – Image1.

  • src2 (np.ndarray.) – Image2.

Returns:

Merged image.

Return type:

np.ndarray

processing.remove_skull(src: ndarray) → ndarray

Removes the skull from an MRI brain image.

Parameters:

src (np.ndarray.) – Image to be processed.

Returns:

Processed image.

Return type:

np.ndarray
